newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Howard says small business key to jobs growth.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Howard says small business key to jobs growth.

text.p: Australian Prime Minister John Howard said on Wednesday that small business was the key to reducing Australia's unemployment rate.
Howard also said inflation data released earlier on Wednesday were "fabulous news", which was good for small business, jobs, investment and home buyers.
"The key to reducing unemployment in Australia remains a growing small business sector," Howard told reporters.
Howard said it would time to reduce unemployment, which was at 8.6 percent in December, but that
"I think everybody would like to abolish unemployment overnight but it's not real life to think that that's going to happen," he told reporters.
He declined to comment on the interest rate implications of today's inflation data.

The data showed the CPI rose 0.2 percent in the December quarter, the lowest quarterly change since the December quarter 1993, for an annual CPI rise of 1.5 percent, the lowest since the March quarter of 1994, official data showed.
The data also showed the Treasury's measure of underlying inflation rose 0.4 percent in the December quarter to stand at 2.1 percent for the year.
